required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Maternal Neonatal Outcomes of Normotensive and Hypertensive Placental Abruptions: A Novel Approach

brief_summary.textblock: Placental abruption is a significant cause of both maternal morbidity and neonatal morbidity and mortality. Most abruptions accept to be related to a chronic placental disease process. Therefore, it is very important to understand these processes. To analyze maternal and neonatal effects of placental abruption(PA) through a novel classification in the presence of hypertension. Initial hemoglobin parameters were also compared to predict pregnancy outcomes in addition to hypertension.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective: We aimed to classify placental abruption according to hypertension status.
Methods: This retrospective cohort designed study was conducted on 115 pregnant women with placental abruption. The main parameters scanned and recorded from the hospital database and patient medical files. Two groups were classified regarding of presence or absence of hypertension (53 hypertensive, 62 normotensive). Maternal demographical and clinical characteristics (abdominal pain, vaginal bleeding) were recorded. APGAR scores below 5 at 1 and 5 min., fetal or neonatal death, admission and length of stay in Neonatal Intensive Care Unit(NICU) were also investigated and compared between the groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: hemogram parameters WBC(white blood cell) ,PLT(Platelet), MPV(mean platelet volume), HGB(hemoglobin), Neutrophil lymphocyte ratio..)
secondary_outcome.description: complete blood test retrospective complete blood count analysis

clinical_study.condition: Abruptio Placentae; Affecting Fetus or Newborn

arm_group.description: Two groups were classified regarding of presence or absence of hypertension (53 hypertensive, 62 normotensive).
Two groups were classified regarding of presence or absence of hypertension (53 hypertensive, 62 normotensive).

intervention.description: Comparison of Hypertensive group and normotensive group

study_pop.textblock: Two groups were formed according to presence or absence of hypertension (53 hypertensive, 62 normotensive) who has placental abruption.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- spontaneous,
- singleton pregnancies
- above 25 weeks of gestations with positive fetal cardiac activity
Exclusion Criteria:
- multiple gestations,
- presence of fetal or maternal infection,
- chronic inflammatory diseases or connective tissue disorders
- history of myocardial infarction,
- thrombosis
- history of steroid drug usage.

patient_data.ipd_description: The data belonging to participant only will be available to any researcher or editorial review board if needed.
